article_title: Feds Say States Can't Sue Over ACA Fee That They Don't Pay
article_text:
Feds Say States Can't Sue Over ACA Fee That They Don't Pay

Law360, New York (January 28, 2016, 5:59 PM ET) -- The federal government on Wednesday shot back at allegations from Texas, Kansas and Louisiana allegations that part of the Affordable Care Act unconstitutionally forces states to pay taxes to the federal government, saying the states have no standing, in part because the disputed ACA fee makes no mention of states.



The states want the Texas federal court to stop Congress from collecting the allegedly overreaching Health Insurance Providers Fee and, in part, seeking the return of the $150 million they say they’ve already paid. The government,...

To view the full article, register now.

article_metadata.description: The federal government has shot back at allegations from Texas, Kansas and Louisiana that part of the Affordable Care Act unconstitutionally forces states to pay taxes to the federal government, saying the states have no standing, in part because the disputed ACA fee makes no mention of states.

The states want the Texas federal court to stop Congress from collecting the allegedly overreaching Health Insurance Providers Fee and, in part, seeking the return of the $150 million they say they’ve already paid.
